bill.title: AN ACT LIMITING AUTO REFILLS OF PRESCRIPTION DRUGS COVERED UNDER THE MEDICAID PROGRAM AND REQUIRING THE COMMISSIONER OF SOCIAL SERVICES TO PROVIDE CHIP DATA TO THE HEALTH INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY OFFICER.
bill.abstract: To prevent unnecessary costs and clinical outcomes associated with prescriptions that are unnecessarily automatically refilled.

bill.title: DEPT-INNOVATION AND TECHNOLOGY
bill.abstract: Creates the Department of Innovation and Technology Act to codify the changes made in Executive Order 2016-001. Creates the Department of Innovation and Technology. Abolishes the Information Technology Office (also known as the Office of the Chief Information Officer) within the Office of the Governor and transfers its functions, personnel, and property to Department of Innovation and Technology. Provides for the transfer of information technology functions, including related personnel and property, from specified State agencies, boards, and commissions to the Department of Innovation and Technology. Provides for the powers and responsibilities of the Department of Innovation and Technology, including specified programs and initiatives. Provides for the appointment of the Secretary and ...

bill.title: REPEAL FUNDS-PROJECTS-BOARDS
bill.abstract: Amends the Executive Reorganization Implementation Act. Makes a technical change in a Section concerning the short title.

bill.title: GAMING-ADVANCE DEPOSIT WAGER
bill.abstract: Amends the Illinois Horse Racing Act of 1975. Extends the authorization for advance deposit wagering to December 31, 2022 (rather than December 31, 2018). Effective immediately.

bill.title: An Act allowing businesses to sign up for the Do Not Call list
bill.abstract: Makes technical changes in other parts of GL c.159C to effectuate this redefinition.

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/25/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

bill.title: An Act prohibiting robocalls to all mobile telephone devices
bill.abstract: Amends provisions of GL c.159C (Telephone Solicitations) to authorize the Attorney General to enforce provisions against robocalls. In particular, the AG may initiate proceedings relating to a knowing violation or threatened knowing violation, and may include an injunction, a civil penalty or $1500-$10,000 for each knowing violation and additional relief in a court of competent jurisdiction. The attorney general may also issue investigative demands and subpoenas, administer oaths and conduct hearings in the course of investigating a violation. A person who has received more than 1 unsolicited telephonic call within a 12-month period by or on behalf of the same person or entity in violation of the prohibition on robocalls may also personally bring an action to enjoin the violation, to ...

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/25/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

bill.title: An Act updating Chapter 93H data security protections to include biometric information
bill.abstract: Amends GL 93H:1 to provide a definition for biometric indicators and to further provide that the same shall be considered personal information under GL Chapter 93H (Security Breaches).

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/25/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

bill.title: An Act to promote economic development and market access for emerging businesses
bill.abstract: Classifies cereal grains, malted grains, hops, fruits, flowers, plants, vegetables, or pure juices from fruits, vegetables or plants, herbs, other natural flavoring materials or extracts derived from infusions, percolations, or maceration of such materials, as agricultural products under the Buy Massachusetts Program in the Massachusetts Office of Business Development; authorizes emerging breweries to terminate the right to distribute any brands of malt beverages for any licensed wholesaler to whom they have previously made regular sales; defines emerging breweries as those that are privately owned and operated, are managed by the owners and produce less than 30,000 barrels per year; regulates notice to wholesalers of the termination of any distribution; requires emerging brewers to ...

bill.title: An Act requiring certain electronic toll collection fee notifications by the Massachusetts Department of Transportation
bill.abstract: ...Lane electronic tolling system. The Governor claims that the existing $100 threshold enacted by the legislature would be cost-prohibitive and violate the contract with the 3rd party vendor administering the system.

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/25/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

bill.title: An Act relative to a report on additional tax reporting requirements
bill.abstract: Department of Revenue by a year.Section 125 requires the Commissioner of Revenue to report on how he has used the authority granted in the budget to depart from federal requirements for 1099-K reporting (used to report income received from income received from electronic payments such as credit cards, debit cards, PayPal, and other third party payers). Currently, 1099-K reporting is carried out during the first two months of a calendar year, and the affected taxpayers may file the affected returns and pay their taxes as late as October of that calendar year. According to the Governor, a report as of March 15 of that calendar year will not be able to provide meaningful fiscal information. A reporting date of March 15, 2019 will allow for the preparation of a meaningful evaluation of the ...

bill.title: An Act relative to Alzheimer's and related dementias in the Commonwealth
bill.abstract: Submits various recommendations relating to the treatment of Alzheimer\'s disease in the commonwealth and the administration of Alzheimer\'s related programs; directs the executive office of health and human services to assess all Alzheimer\'s related state programs and to create and maintain an integrated state plan to overcome it; requires the plan to include implementation steps and priorities based on the results of the assessment; establishes and regulates the membership of an advisory council to provide advice to the executive office on Alzheimer\'s, determine the number of people in the Commonwealth with early-onset Alzheimer\'s, determine the needs of such individuals, regardless of age and provide an annual report which evaluates all state funded efforts in research, clinical care ...

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/25/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

bill.title: An Act removing fees for security freezes and disclosures of consumer credit reports
bill.abstract: Establishes and modifies various provisions of the General Laws relating to the protection of consumer financial and credit information. In particular, the bill establishes a new GL 93:51B, prohibiting the use of consumer credit reports in connection with credit applications without the written, verbal or electronic consent of the consumer; defines failure to obtain consent as an unfair business practice under GL93A; amends GL 93:56 regarding disclosures made by consumer reporting agencies, by authorizing the delivery of consumer credit reports in electronic format; allows submission of disputes through electronic mail; reduces the timeline for confirmation of receipt of credit freeze requests from 5 days after request to 3 days after receipt; requires consumer reporting agencies to comply ...

sponsor.name: Joint Committee on Telecommunications, Utilities & Energy

bill.title: An Act relative to hydro
bill.abstract: Amends GL 25A:11F relating to the renewable energy portfolio standard for retail electricity suppliers; defines relicensed hydroelectric facilities that receive a new license after January 1, 2018 under the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission Rules, as Class I renewable energy generating sources; requires relicensed hydroelectric facilities seeking to operate as a Class I renewable energy generating source to provide formal notice to the department of energy resources. (New draft of HB2697. The new draft replaces the prior text pertaining to net metering tariffs for small hydroelectric power net metering facilities, with new language relating to classification of relicensed hydroelectric facilities as Class I renewable energy generating sources.)

bill.title: An Act providing for the terms of certain bonds to be issued by the Commonwealth
bill.abstract: Amends various provisions related to the 2018 Act Financing The Production and Preservation of Housing for Low And Moderate Income Resdients (2018:99); eliminates the January 1, 2018 effective date for both increases in the Massachusetts historic rehabilitation tax credit and the deadline extension to qualify for environmental response actions corporate tax credits; additionally establishes a new effective date of January 1, 2019 for various provisions related to the elimination of eligibility restriction for the low-income housing tax credit, implementation of a new low-income housing tax credit up to $5,000,000 for preserving and improving existing state or federally-assisted housing, and eligibility for and maximum amounts taken under community investment tax credits; limits all bonds ...

bill.title: An Act relative to economic development in the commonwealth
bill.abstract: Massachusetts Growth Capital Corporation. Additional appropriations added during House floor debate include 116,975,000 for municipal public infrastructure grants, and another $8,840,000 for local economic development projects. (Please note that together these two new line-items include almost 120 earmarks as part of the inside language.)\r\rIn the outside sections, among other things, the bill increases the maximum amount of refundable tax credits which may be granted to a project by the EACC from $5,000,000 to $7,500,000; exempts refundable tax credits granted to projects designated as extraordinary economic development opportunities from the maximum credit cap; allows EACC to grant additional credits in excess of existing caps for certified projects designated as extraordinary economic ...

bill.title: An Act for prevention and access to appropriate care and treatment of addiction
bill.abstract: ...This bill is intended to improve the availability of substance use disorder treatment, by expanding the range of medical professionals authorized to perform the evaluation and by requiring that the emergency department affirmatively connect the patient with the appropriate level of care. The bill also permits medical professionals or police officers to authorize the transport of a patient to a substance use treatment facility for emergency assessment and treatment when the patient presents a risk of serious harm due to addiction and the patient will not agree to voluntary treatment. Additionally, the bill increases access to the overdose drug naloxone by guaranteeing that practitioners who prescribe and pharmacists who dispense naloxone in good faith will be protected from criminal or ...

bill.title: An Act relative to solar power in environmental justice and urban communities
bill.abstract: Establishes a framework for the allocation of solar energy market net metering credits for low-income and Environmental Justice households; defines low-income households under GL 40T, related to publicly assisted affordable housing; defines environmental justice households as those with an annual median household income equal to or less than 65 percent of the statewide median, or whose population is up to 25 percent minority or lacking English language proficiency; allows low-income and environmental justice households to take the same market net metering credits as municipal or governmental entities; allows low-income solar net metering facilities to receive credits, and exempts them from demand side management and renewable energy kilowatt-hour charges; increases aggregate net metering ...

bill.title: An Act to increase container recycling in the Commonwealth
bill.abstract: Secretary of Environmental Affairs to establish a process for determining the diversion rate and the redemption rate. If, by December 31, 2023, the mean diversion rate for any two year period is found by EOEA to be equal to or greater than the mean redemption rate in the corresponding two year period, then this section is to be repealed automatically.

bill.title: An Act expanding the sale of products by farmer breweries and distilleries
bill.abstract: Amends GL 138:15F, by permitting municipalities to issue special licenses for the sale of malt beverages produced by farmer-brewers and for the sale of distilled spirits by farmer-distilleries at indoor or outdoor agricultural events; requires the beverages to be sealed and intended for off-premises consumption; limits sample sizes of the malt beverages to 2 ounces; limits sample sizes of distilled spirits to 1/4 of an ounce. (New draft of SB418. The new draft adds the ability to sell sample sizes of distilled spirits, and makes additional grammatical and technical changes to the previous text.)

bill.title: Palliative Care and Hospice Education and Training Act
bill.abstract: ...This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to require the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to provide support for Palliative Care and Hospice Education Centers. These centers must improve the training of health professionals in palliative care and establish traineeships for individuals preparing for advanced education nursing degrees, social work degrees, or advanced degrees in physician assistant studies in palliative care.</p> <p>HHS may provide support to schools of medicine, schools of osteopathic medicine, teaching hospitals, and graduate medical education programs for training physicians who plan to teach palliative medicine.</p> <p>HHS must: (1) provide Palliative Medicine and Hospice Academic Career Awards to individuals to promote their career development; (2) ...

bill.title: John S. McCain National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2019
bill.abstract: ...This bill authorizes FY2019 appropriations and sets forth policies for Department of Defense (DOD) programs and activities, including military personnel strengths. It does not provide budget authority, which is provided in subsequent appropriations legislation. </p> <p>The bill authorizes appropriations to DOD for: (1) Procurement, including aircraft, missiles, weapons and tracked combat vehicles, ammunition, shipbuilding and conversion, and space procurement; (2) Research, Development, Test, and Evaluation; (3) Operation and Maintenance; (4) Working Capital Funds; (5) Chemical Agents and Munitions Destruction; (6) Drug Interdiction and Counter-Drug Activities; (7) the Defense Inspector General; (8) the Defense Health Program; (9) the Armed Forces Retirement Home; (10) Overseas Contingency ...

bill.abstract: <p><b>Department of the Interior, Environment, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2019</b></p> <p>Provides FY2019 appropriations for the Department of the Interior, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), and related agencies. </p> <p>Provides appropriations to Interior for: </p> <ul> <li> the Bureau of Land Management, </li> <li> the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, </li> <li> the National Park Service, </li> <li> the U.S. Geological Survey, </li> <li> the Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, </li> <li> the Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement, </li> <li> the Office of Surface Mining Reclamation and Enforcement, and </li> <li> the Bureau of Indian Affairs and Bureau of Indian Education. </li> </ul> <p>Provides appropriations to Interior for Departmental Offices, including: ...
